  • Low-Level API
    • Object-Relational Model (ORM)
    • Prerequisites
    • 1. Ingest a Dataset
      • Object Relational Model (ORM)
      • a) Registering Datasets
        • Dataset.Tabular
        • Dataset.Sequence
        • Dataset.Image
      • b) Reading Datasets into Memory
        • Dataset.Tabular
        • Dataset.Sequence
        • Dataset.Image
    • 2. Selecting Features and Labels.
      • a) Select the Label column(s).
        • ORM
        • Deriving Labels
        • Reading Labels
      • b) Select the Feature column(s).
        • ORM
        • Specifying Features
        • Reading Features
    • 3. Slicing samples.
      • a) Define sliding time series Windows.
        • ORM
        • Specifying Windows
        • Reading Windows
      • b) Slice samples with a Splitset.
        • Stratification
        • Splitting Strategies
        • Reading Splitsets
      • c) fold_count triggers cross-validation.
        • ORM
        • Fold objects
        • Specifying Folds
        • Reading Folds
    • 4. Preprocessing - Interpolation.
      • ORM
      • a) Interpolate Labels with LabelInterpolater.
      • b) Interpolate Features with Interpolaterset.
    • 5. Preprocessing - Encoding.
      • Encoding
      • a) Encode labels with LabelCoder.
        • Creating a LabelCoder
      • b) Encode Features sequentially with FeatureCoders.
        • Filtering feature columns
    • 6. Preprocessing - Reshaping.
      • ORM
      • Reshaping by Index
      • Reshaping Explicitly
      • Multiplicative Reshaping
    • 7. Defining Architectures & Hyperparameters.
      • a) Define an Algorithm
        • Model Definition
        • Group the functions together in an Algorithm!
      • b) Combinations of hyperparameters with Hyperparamset.
        • Hyperparameter Selection Strategies.
        • Hyperparamcombo objects.
    • 8. Queue of training Jobs.
      • a) Job objects.
      • b) Executing Jobs.
        • i) queue.run_jobs()
        • ii) DEPRECATED - queue.run_jobs(in_background=True).
      • c) Predictors are the trained models.
        • Fetching the trained model.
        • Fetching the hyperparameters.
      • d) Predictions are the output of a Predictor.
        • Fetching metrics.
    • 9. Metrics & Visualization

  • Competition
  • Mission
    • Why Does AIQC Exist?
    • 1. Accelerate science by making deep learning accessible.
    • 2. Bring the scientific method to data science.
    • 3. Break down walled gardens to keep science open.
AIQC
  • »
  • AIQC
  • View page source


Open Source MLOps


Declarative framework that makes deep learning accessible for scientific research






↳ Sponsored by
↳ Blogged by
↳ Presented at





↳ How does AIQC compare to other experiment trackers?




Reduce data wrangling with a declarative API for machine learning



>
<














Write 90% less glue-code with rapid, rigorous, & reproducible workflows


Tabular
(2D)		 Sequence
(3D)		 Image
(4D)
Classification
(binary, multi)		 ✓ ✓ ✓
Quantification
(regression)		 ✓ ✓ ✓
Forecasting
(multivariate)		 ✓ ✓ ✓


AIQC provides structured protocols that automate data wrangling processes that vary based on: analysis type (e.g. categorize, quantify, generate), data type (e.g. spreadsheet, sequence, image), and data dimensionality (e.g. timepoints per sample).

The DIY approach of patching together custom code and toolsets for each analysis is not maintainable because it places a skillset burden of both data science and software engineering upon a research team.









How do you quality control (QC) your machine learning lifecycle?


Train Validation Test Inference
Prevent evaluation bias with
3-way+ stratification.		 Validate the structure
of new samples.
Prevent data leakage by only using preprocessing information derived from the training split/fold. Prevent data drift by
using original preprocessors.
Prevent overfitting by evaluating each
split/ fold of every model		 Detect model rot by reevaluating with supervised datasets.
Ensure reproducibility by using a standardized framework
that records the entire workflow.










Automated visualizations for evaluating each split & fold of every model








AIQC











Zero server setup for a metastore, dataset registry, & experiment tracker
